Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AILCODECSETPREF

The function AILCODECSETPREF provides a way for ASI preferences to be set during a compression or decompression.

S32 AILCODECSETPREF(
  char const * preference,
  U32 value
);

In Parameters

preference
indicates the preference name to set.
value
indicates the value to set the preference to.

Returns

1 if the preference set was successful, 0 if the preference set failed.

Discussion

This function address is provided in the value parameter of the AILLENGTHYCB function when the AIL_LENGTHY_SET_PREFERENCE state is passed.

The Miles MPEG encoder defines the following preferences:

"Requested bit rate": which specifies the output bit rate to use in kilobits per second - you may use: 32,40,48,56,64,80,96,112,128,160,192,224,256,320).

"Requested sample rate": which specifies the output playback (for MPEG I Layer 3, this means 32000, 44100, or 48000 Hz).

"Requested # of channels": which is the number of output channels (1 for mono, 2 for stereo).


Group: Utility Services
Related Functions: AILLENGTHYCB
Related Basic Types: MILES_LENGTHY_STATE, S32, U32, char const *
